content.webTitle: Aston Villa 1-2 Liverpool, Manchester City 2-1 Southampton and more – as it happened

fields.headline: Aston Villa 1-2 Liverpool, Manchester City 2-1 Southampton and more – as it happened
fields.bodyText: In the Football League today ... Premier League: Brighton missed enough chances to win several games, before finding their range and seeing off Norwich City. Premier League: Paul MacInnes was at the London Stadium, where Ciaran Clark, Federico Fernandez and Jonjo Shelvey got the goals that won the points for Newcastle. Premier League: Louise Taylor went to Bramall Lane to see a side that ranks “among the division’s most interesting and entertaining teams” pulverise their visitors. Premier League: Paul Doyle was at Villa Park to see what could come to be seen as a season-defining smash-and-grab from Liverpool, who left it very late to take all three points. Premier League: Jamie Jackson was at the Etihad Stadium to see Manchester City come from behind and record their second win in a week over Southampton. Premier League: “Granit Xhaka spent the afternoon away from the Emirates but Arsenal proceeded to show that their problems extend far beyond one man,” writes Nick Ames at the Emirates. Premier League: Ben Fisher was at the Vitality Stadium, where Bournemouth scored the only goal of a diabolically bad game to take the points and send Ole Gunnar Solskjær’s men home empty-handed. Tables: You can see how today’s results affected your team’s league placing by clicking on this link and locating the pertinent division. All you need to know about the Premier League table, where Liverpool lead Manchester City by six points, although the top of top tier looked likely to take on a very different complexion with just three minutes of their match against Aston Villa to go. Watford v Chelsea: Scott Murray has all the team news and build-up as the Premier League’s basement-dwellers, still looking for their first Premier League win of the season, take on Chelsea. League Two results Bradford City 2-0 Exeter City Cambridge United 2-1 Crawley Carlisle 2-1 Macclesfield Cheltenham 1-2 Forest Green Crewe 0-1 Port Vale Mansfield 2-3 Colchester Morecambe 1-0 Leyton Orient Newport 1-2 Salford City Oldham 2-2 Northampton Plymouth v Grimsby (postponed) Scunthorpe 0-0 Stevenage Swindon 2-1 Walsall League One results Wimbledon 1-1 Lincoln City Blackpool 4-3 Peterborough Bolton Wanderers 2-1 Fleetwood Doncaster 2-2 Burton Albion Gillingham 0-3 Rotherham MK Dons 1-3 Tranmere Rochdale 1-2 Bristol Rovers Sunderland 1-0 Southend Wycombe 1-0 Shrewsbury Coventry City 0-0 Accrington Portsmouth 1-0 Oxford United Wigan 1-2 Swansea City Cardiff City 4-2 Birmingham City Derby County 2-0 Middlesbrough Fulham 0-3 Hull City Leeds United 2-0 QPR Luton Town 1-2 Nottingham Forest Reading 2-1 Millwall Blackburn Rovers 1-1 Sheffield Wednesday Brentford 0-1 Huddersfield Bournemouth 1-0 Manchester United Arsenal 1-1 Wolves Aston Villa 1-2 Liverpool Brighton 2-0 Norwich City Manchester City 2-1 Southampton Sheffield United 3-0 Burnley West Ham 2-3 Newcastle Watford v Chelsea (5.30pm GMT) Premier League: Liverpool lead!!! Sadio Mane scores with a flick-on from a late, late, late 94th minute corner to snatch all three points for Liverpool. The players of Aston Villa and Manchester City will be devastated. Championship: Sheffield Wednesday and Blackburn trade goals at Ewood Park, where it’s 1-1. At the Cardiff City Stadium, the hosts have conceded a second goal scored by Birmingham’s Ivan Sunjic and now only lead 3-2. But what’s this? Joe Ralls responds with his second of the day to make it 4-2. At Elland Road, Leeds have doubled their lead over QPR, with Jack Harrison doing the honours. It’s 2-0 to Marcelo Bielsa’s men. Premier League: The goals are raining in late doors and Robert Snodgrass scores his second in two games to keep West Ham in with a shout of rescuing a most unlikely point. Premier League: Andy Robertson scores his third goal for Liverpool and it’s a timely one. They’re level at Villa Park. Premier League: Shane Duffy prods home from a free-kick to double Brighton’s lead. There’s a VAR consultation to see if he was offside, but the goal stands. Premier League: Alex McCarthy misses a cross from the right and Kyle Walker is on hand to capitalise. In very bad news indeed for Liverpool as well as Southampton, the champions lead. Premier League: Manchester City go close to taking the lead after Southampton goalkeeper Alex McCarthy handles a backpass and concedes a free-kick. Meanwhile at Villa Park, Aston Villa miss a decent chance to double their unlikely lead over Liverpool. Championship latest Wigan 1-2 Swansea City (result) Cardiff City 3-1 Birmingham City Derby County 1-0 Middlesbrough Fulham 0-2 Hull City Leeds United 1-0 QPR Luton Town 0-2 Nottingham Forest Reading 2-1 Millwall Blackburn Rovers 0-0 Sheffield Wednesday Brentford 0-1 Huddersfield League One latest Wimbledon 0-1 Lincoln City Blackpool 4-3 Peterborough Bolton Wanderers 2-0 Fleetwood Doncaster 2-2 Burton Albion Gillingham 0-2 Rotherham MK Dons 1-3 Tranmere Rochdale 1-2 Bristol Rovers Sunderland 1-0 Southend Wycombe 1-0 Shrewsbury Coventry City 0-0 Accrington Portsmouth 1-0 Oxford United League Two latest Bradford City 2-0 Exeter City Cambridge United 0-0 Crawley Carlisle 1-1 Macclesfield Cheltenham 1-2 Forest Green Crewe 0-1 Port Vale Mansfield 1-2 Colchester Morecambe 1-0 Leyton Orient Newport 1-2 Salford City Oldham 0-1 Northampton Plymouth v Grimsby (postponed) Scunthorpe 0-0 Stevenage Swindon 2-1 Walsall Premier League: A lapse in concentration at the back from Arsenal (no, really) allows Wolves to get in behind. Raul Jimenez heads home at the far post in the 76th minute. Premier League latest Arsenal 1-0 Wolves Aston Villa 1-0 Liverpool Brighton 1-0 Norwich City Manchester City 1-1 Southampton Sheffield United 3-0 Burnley West Ham 1-3 Newcastle Watford v Chelsea (5.30pm GMT) Premier League: West Ham have been getting battered, but Fabian Balbuena gives them a glimmer of hope at the London Stadium with 17 minutes and the extras to go. Premier League: Leandro Trossard has come off the bench to give Brighton a long overdue lead, prodding home a Martin Montoya cross from the right. Premier League: Southampton have been clinging on, but Sergio Aguero sticks out a foot and converts a Kyle Walker cross to equalise for Manchester City. Championship latest Huddersfield have just gone a goal up against Brentford at Griffin Park through Karlan Grant, while Joe Ralls has given 10-man Cardiff City a 3-1 lead against Birmingham. Millwall have pulled a goal back against Reading, who they trail 2-1. Wigan 1-2 Swansea City (result) Cardiff City 3-1 Birmingham City Derby County 1-0 Middlesbrough Fulham 0-2 Hull City Leeds United 1-0 QPR Luton Town 0-2 Nottingham Forest Reading 2-1 Millwall Blackburn Rovers 0-0 Sheffield Wednesday Brentford 0-1 Huddersfield League One: At the split second I published that update, Portsmouth went 1-0 up against Oxford United. In a moment of duplicitous improvisation, I went back in, added the score and published it again. League One latest Wimbledon 0-1 Lincoln City Blackpool 3-2 Peterborough Bolton Wanderers 2-0 Fleetwood Doncaster 2-2 Burton Albion Gillingham 0-2 Rotherham MK Dons 1-2 Tranmere Rochdale 1-2 Bristol Rovers Sunderland 1-0 Southend Wycombe 1-0 Shrewsbury Coventry City 0-0 Accrington Portsmouth 1-0 Oxford United League Two latest Bradford City 2-0 Exeter City Cambridge United 0-0 Crawley Carlisle 1-1 Macclesfield Cheltenham 0-2 Forest Green Crewe 0-1 Port Vale Mansfield 1-1 Colchester Morecambe 0-0 Leyton Orient Newport 1-2 Salford City Oldham 0-1 Northampton Plymouth v Grimsby (postponed) Scunthorpe 0-0 Stevenage Swindon 2-1 Walsall Championship: Fulham trail Hull City by two goals to nil after Jarrod Bowen scores his fifth goal in four games with a fine bit of individual skill. Championship: Cardiff City lead Birmingham City by the odd goal of three but are down to 10 men. Danny Ward has been sent off for a reckless tackle on Kerim Mrabti. Meanwhile at Kenilworth Road, it’s 2-0 to Nottingham Forest in their match against Luton Town, with Sammy Ameobi adding their second. Premier League: It remains scoreless at the Amex Stadium between Brighton and Norwich, but the home fans will wonder how on earth they aren’t leading. Aaron Connolly and Davy Propper have both gone close, while Neal Maupay missed two good chances - one the sitter of the season - just before the break. Premier League: Moments after his team had a goal disallowed, Jonjo Shelvey adds Newcastle’s third with an excellent free-kick. Roberto gets a hand to it but can’t keep it out. Premier League: Newcastle have been pounding West Ham at the London Stadium and are 2-0 up courtesy of goals from Joelinton and Ciaran Clark. DeAndre Yedlin has just had what he thought was his team’s third correctly chalked off for offside. Meanwhile at the Emirates: The Independent’s has been keeping an eye on the official media room Remembrance cake. It’s taken until just moments ago for somebody to work up the courage to desecrate cut it. If you fancy a giggle, read the thread. League One half-times Wimbledon 0-1 Lincoln City Blackpool 2-2 Peterborough Bolton Wanderers 2-0 Fleetwood Doncaster 1-1 Burton Albion Gillingham 0-2 Rotherham MK Dons 1-1 Tranmere Rochdale 1-2 Bristol Rovers Sunderland 1-0 Southend Wycombe 0-0 Shrewsbury Coventry City 0-0 Accrington Portsmouth 0-0 Oxford United (still playing) League Two half-times Bradford City 2-0 Exeter City Cambridge United 0-0 Crawley Carlisle 1-1 Macclesfield Cheltenham 0-2 Forest Green Crewe 0-0 Port Vale Mansfield 1-1 Colchester Morecambe 0-0 Leyton Orient Newport 1-1 Salford City Oldham 0-1 Northampton Plymouth v Grimsby (postponed) Scunthorpe 0-0 Stevenage Swindon 1-0 Walsall Bournemouth 1-0 Man United (result) Arsenal 1-0 Wolves Aston Villa 1-0 Liverpool Brighton 0-0 Norwich City Manchester City 0-1 Southampton Sheffield United 3-0 Burnley West Ham 0-2 Newcastle Watford v Chelsea (5.30pm GMT) Championship half-times Wigan 1-2 Swansea City (result) Cardiff City 2-1 Birmingham City Derby County 1-0 Middlesbrough Fulham 0-1 Hull City Leeds United 1-0 QPR Luton Town 0-1 Nottingham Forest Reading 2-0 Millwall Blackburn Rovers 0-0 Sheffield Wednesday Brentford 0-0 Huddersfield Premier League: John Fleck riffs on Burnley’s not inconsiderable first half pain with a first-time strike into the bottom corner after neat passing play from Sheffield United. Premier League: John Lundstram scores his second of the day, getting on the end of an Enda Stevens cross to convert from close range. Championship: Sam Baldock controls a cross on the edge of the penalty area and fires home from distance to put Reading two goals to the good against Millwall at the Madejski Stadium. Meanwhile at Kenilworth Road, Nottingham Forest’s Lewis Grabban finds himself in a one-on-one with Luton goalkeeper James Shea and gives his team a one-goal lead away from home. At the Cardiff City Stadium, the home side have come from behind to lead Birmingham by the odd goal of three. And at Elland Road, Leeds have edged ahead against QPR, courtesy of Tyler Roberts’ strike in the 39th minute. Championship: A goal down against Derby County at Pride Park, where Tom Lawrence put the home side ahead, Middlesbrough are down to 10 men. George Saville overstretched to control a pass and took out Krystian Bielik and duly received a red card. League One latest Wimbledon 0-1 Lincoln City Blackpool 1-1 Peterborough Bolton Wanderers 2-0 Fleetwood Doncaster 0-0 Burton Albion Gillingham 0-1 Rotherham MK Dons 0-1 Tranmere Rochdale 0-2 Bristol Rovers Sunderland 1-0 Southend Wycombe 0-0 Shrewsbury Coventry City 0-0 Accrington Portsmouth 0-0 Oxford United League Two latest Bradford City 0-0 Exeter City Cambridge United 0-0 Crawley Carlisle 0-1 Macclesfield Cheltenham 0-1 Forest Green Crewe 0-0 Port Vale Mansfield 0-1 Colchester Morecambe 0-0 Leyton Orient Newport 0-0 Salford City Oldham 0-1 Northampton Plymouth v Grimsby (postponed) Scunthorpe 0-0 Stevenage Swindon 1-0 Walsall Premier League: Roberto Firmino “scores” an equaliser for Liverpool that is controversially ruled out for offside after a lengthy VAR consultation. Championship latest Wigan 1-2 Swansea City (result) Cardiff City 0-1 Birmingham City Derby County 1-0 Middlesbrough Fulham 0-1 Hull City Leeds United 0-0 QPR Luton Town 0-0 Nottingham Forest Reading 1-0 Millwall Blackburn Rovers 0-0 Sheffield Wednesday Brentford 0-0 Huddersfield Premier League latest Bournemouth 1-0 Man United (result) Arsenal 1-0 Wolves Aston Villa 1-0 Liverpool Brighton 0-0 Norwich City Manchester City 0-1 Southampton Sheffield United 1-0 Burnley West Ham 0-2 Newcastle Watford v Chelsea (5.30pm GMT) Premier League: West Ham goalkeeper Roberto is stranded as he comes for a cross he had no chance of intercepting, allowing Federico Fernandez to score Newcastle’s second. Premier League: Trezeguet scores with a tap-in at Villa Park. There’s a VAR consultation for a possible offside, but the goal stands and Liverpool are behind. Premier League: Very much against the run of early play, Arsenal go ahead at the Emirates with Pierre Emerick-Aubamayang doing the honours. He scored into the corner after Lacazette provided the assist. Premier League: John Lundstram scores his second goal of the season to give his team an early lead at Bramall Lane. Premier League: Ciaran Clark puts Newcastle into the lead with a goal in the 16th minute at the London Stadium. Premier League: James Ward-Prowse capitalises on a fumble by Ederson to score on the follow-up and give Southampton the most unlikely of leads from just a couple of yards out. Championship: Josh Bowler, on loan at Hull from Everton, puts the Tigers one up against Fulham with his first senior goal. Championship: At the Madejski Stadium, Jordan Obita has given Reading a ninth-minute lead over Millwall with a low drive into the corner. Premier League: Aston Villa seem to be having the better of things in the early stages of their game against Liverpool. They’ve had two good chances but failed to convert either of them. League Two latest Bradford City 0-0 Exeter City Cambridge United 0-0 Crawley Carlisle 0-0 Macclesfield Cheltenham 0-0 Forest Green Crewe 0-0 Port Vale Mansfield 0-0 Colchester Morecambe 0-0 Leyton Orient Newport 0-0 Salford City Oldham 0-1 Northampton Plymouth 0-0 Grimsby Scunthorpe 0-0 Stevenage Swindon 1-0 Walsall Premier League: Aaron Connolly has had two early shots on goal for Brighton in their match against Norwich City, but has failed to get his side off the mark. Championship: With just two wins in their past 10 Championship games, Cardiff City have gone behind to Birmingham City in the Welsh capital. Kristian Pedersen poked home at the Cardiff City Stadium. Peep! Play has begun in all or Premier League games, but the first goal is scored in Scotland, where Airdrie’s Calum Gallagher has taken seconds to put his side ahead against Dumbarton in the Scottish League One. Not long now: Teams are click-clacking their way down tunnels all over the country with just a couple of minutes to go before today’s three o’clocker get under way. Ben Fisher drew what turned out to be a very short straw indeed and trekked off to a wet and windy Vitality Stadium to watch Bournemouth beat Manchester United in a terrible game of football. Here’s how he saw the action unfold ... Full time: Wigan Athletic 1-2 Swansea City Championship: Sam Surridge struck late in the game to win the game for Swansea City by the odd goal of three. The Swans have gone top of the Championship, a point clear of West Brom – who don’t play until Monday – having played one game more. Premier League: On a wet and windy day at the Vitality Stadium, Josh King provided the one moment of quality in a match that won’t live long in the memory to take the points for Bournemouth on the stroke of half-time. Arsenal v Wolves line-ups Arsenal: Leno, Chambers, Papastathopoulos, Luiz, Tierney, Ozil, Guendouzi, Torreira, Ceballos, Lacazette, Aubameyang. Subs: Bellerin, Pepe, Martinez, Willock, Kolasinac, Martinelli, Saka. Wolves: Rui Patricio, Dendoncker, Coady, Saiss, Doherty, Joao Moutinho, Neves, Jonny, Traore, Jimenez, Jota. Subs: Pedro Neto, Cutrone, Gibbs-White, Ruddy, Perry, Ruben Vinagre, Kilman. Referee: Michael Oliver (Northumberland) Manchester City v Southampton line-ups Man City: Ederson, Walker, Stones, Fernandinho, Jose Angelino, De Bruyne, Gundogan, Silva, Bernardo Silva, Aguero, Sterling. Subs: Bravo, Gabriel Jesus, Mendy, Mahrez, Joao Cancelo, Otamendi, Foden. Southampton: McCarthy, Valery, Bednarek, Stephens, Vestergaard, Hojbjerg, Ward-Prowse, Romeu, Armstrong, Ings, Redmond. Subs: Yoshida, Long, Adams, Djenepo, Boufal, Gunn, Danso. Referee: Lee Mason (Lancashire) Aston Villa v Liverpool line-ups Aston Villa: Heaton, Guilbert, Engels, Mings, Targett, McGinn, Nakamba, Douglas Luiz, El Ghazi, Wesley, Trezeguet. Subs: Taylor, Lansbury, Steer, Hourihane, Konsa, Kodjia, Elmohamady. Liverpool: Alisson, Alexander-Arnold, Lovren, van Dijk, Robertson, Henderson, Wijnaldum, Lallana, Salah, Firmino, Mane. Subs: Fabinho, Milner, Keita, Gomez, Adrian, Oxlade-Chamberlain, Origi. Referee: Jon Moss (W Yorkshire) West Ham v Newcastle line-ups West Ham: Roberto, Zabaleta, Balbuena, Diop, Cresswell, Rice, Yarmolenko, Noble, Snodgrass, Felipe Anderson, Haller. Subs: Lanzini, Sanchez, Fornals, Ogbonna, Fredericks, Martin, Ajeti. Newcastle: Dubravka, Yedlin, Fernandez, Lascelles, Clark, Willems, Almiron, Hayden, Shelvey, Saint-Maximin, Joelinton. Subs: Dummett, Carroll, Gayle, Krafth, Darlow, Matthew Longstaff, Atsu. Referee: Stuart Attwell (Warwickshire) Brighton v Norwich line-ups Brighton: Ryan, Montoya, Webster, Dunk, Burn, Gross, Propper, Stephens, Alzate, Maupay, Connolly. Subs: Duffy, Trossard, Murray, Mooy, March, Schelotto, Button. Norwich: Krul, Aarons, Tettey, Godfrey, Lewis, McLean, Trybull, Emi, Stiepermann, Hernandez, Pukki. Subs: Byram, Leitner, Cantwell, Drmic, Fahrmann, Amadou, Srbeny. Referee: Kevin Friend (Leicestershire) Sheffield United v Burnley line-ups Sheffield United: Henderson, Basham, Egan, O’Connell, Baldock, Lundstram, Norwood, Fleck, Stevens, Mousset, McGoldrick. Subs: Luke Freeman, McBurnie, Sharp, Robinson, Jagielka, Moore, Besic. Burnley: Pope, Lowton, Tarkowski, Mee, Pieters, Hendrick, Westwood, Cork, McNeil, Rodriguez, Barnes. Subs: Taylor, Brady, Gibson, Hart, Lennon, Bardsley, Vydra. Referee: Simon Hooper (Wiltshire) Mesut Ozil starts for Arsenal: We’ll be bringing you team news from all the Premier League games any second now, but here’s some to get you started. After his impressive performance for Arsenal in their midweek Carabao defeat at the hands of Liverpool, Mesut Ozil starts for Arsenal. Granit Xhaka, you will be unsurprised to hear, does not. There’s no place for the club captain in Unai Emery’s match-day squad. League Two At the top of the table, Crewe entertain Port Vale, who are eight points and 10 places behind them. In second place, Exeter City travel to Bradford City, who will overtake their visitors in the event of victory. League One A couple of days after Sunderland chief executive Charlie Methven confirmed there has been a significant but unspecified investment of funds into the club by the American consortium FPP Sunderland Group, Phil Parkinson’s side play struggling Southend at the Stadium of Light. A relatively new recruit like his opposite number, Sol Campbell will be in the adjacent technical penalty area. Having originally been slated to play Bury, who have been expelled from the league, leaders Ipswich Town have the weekend off. Behind them on goal difference, Wycombe will go top with a win or draw over Shrewsbury Town. A win for Peterborough at Blackpool will also send them a point clear of Ipswich. Championship Barnsley and Bristol City played out a 2-2 draw at Oakwell last night, while the DW Stadium is the venue for today’s early game. Wigan Athletic are currently hosting Swansea City and its all square at the interval, with both sides having scored a goal apiece. Premier League The weekend’s Premier League action kicked off at the Vitality Stadium, where Bournemouth are entertaining Manchester United in today’s lunchtime kick-off. It’s been hammering down with rain on the south coast and the standard of football fare on offer has been almost comically bad. Bournemouth have taken the lead, however, with Josh King putting them a goal up with his third goal of the season just moments before the half-time whistle. The second half has just got under way. Welcome to Saturday Clockwatch, your one-stop shop for all the news from today’s three o’clock kick-offs. We’ll bring you team news, build-up and news of all the major talking points from six Premier League games, flagging up goals as they go in (and are subsequently disallowed by VAR) around the grounds. We’ll also keep a beady eye on all the goings-on in the Championship and beyond, so stay tuned to for regular updates.
